# [R packages](https://cran.r-project.org/web/checks/check_results_hugo.gruson_r_at_normalesup.org.html)

- [pavo](https://cran.r-project.org/package=pavo), with Rafael Maia and Tom White: A cohesive framework for parsing, analysing and organising colour from spectral data. Peer-reviewed and published by Methods in Ecology and Evolution.
  
- [lightr](https://cran.r-project.org/package=lightr) with Rafael Maia and Tom White: Parse various reflectance/transmittance/absorbance spectra file formats to extract spectral data and metadata. Peer-reviewed by rOpenSci and published in Journal of Open Source Software.

- [rromeo](https://cran.r-project.org/package=rromeo), with Matthias Grenié: Fetches information from the ['SHERPA/RoMEO API'](http://www.sherpa.ac.uk/romeo/apimanual.php) which indexes policies of journal regarding the archival of scientific manuscripts before and/or after peer-review as well as formatted manuscripts. Peer-reviewed by rOpenSci.

- [contactdata](https://cran.r-project.org/pavo=contactdata): Data package for the supplementary data in [Prem et al. (2017). Provides easy access to contact data for 152 countries, for use in epidemiological, demographic or social sciences research.

- [asymptor](https://cran.r-project.org/package=asymptor): The asymptor R package allows you to estimate the lower and upper bound of asymptomatic cases in an epidemic using the capture/recapture methods from [Böhning et al. (2020)](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.ijid.2020.06.009) and [Rocchetti et al. (2020)](https://doi.org/10.1101/2020.07.14.20153445)

# Other software

- [ULM (Unified Life Models)](https://www.biologie.ens.fr/~legendre/ulm/ulm.html) with Stéphane Legendre, François Bienvenu, Guilhem Doulcier, and Maxime Woringer: Software coded in free pascal, with a GTK or Qt graphical interface, enabling the simulation and analysis of deterministic and stochastic discrete time dynamical systems for population dynamics modeling.
